What if Iâ€™m average, don't have any "talent", and thatâ€™s the truth?

Then congratulations. You just got rid of the most dangerous excuse in the world.

That "talented" person you're looking at? 
They've been doing the thing for years while you were still wondering if you're gifted enough to start. 

They made a 1000 ugly attempts you never witnessed. 
They showed up on days they felt nothing, created garbage they were ashamed of, got rejected so many times they stopped counting. 

And then one day, they did something great, and you looked at it and said, "wow, natural talent." 

As if their whole journey didn't exist. As if they just woke up like that.

You want the universe to whisper "you're the chosen one" before you risk anything. 

But the universe doesn't do that. 
The universe rewards movement, not potential. 
It doesn't care if you're gifted. It only cares if you show up.

And here's the funniest part, average people built the world. 
The people running successful businesses, creating things that matter, most of them are terrifyingly ordinary. 

They weren't top of their class, didn't have rich parents or special connections. They just picked something and stuck with it longer than everyone else. 

The world isn't run by geniuses. 
It's run by regular people who didn't quit.

Being average and knowing it is a cheat code. 
You've got nothing to lose. No â€œtalentedâ€ identity to protect.

You already know you're not special. 
You have no ego about being a natural. 

So you can just put your head down and work like thatâ€™s all you have got.

How do I regain confidence when I know I've been lazy and inconsistent?

Confidence isn't some mood you can summon with affirmations in the mirror. 

Confidence is just your brain's prediction of what you'll do based on what you've done. 

And right now, your brain has proof that when you say you'll wake up early, you don't. 

When you say you'll start Monday, you won't. 
When you promise yourself, "this time will be different," it isn't. 

So why would your brain let you feel confident? 
It's trying to protect you from the embarrassment of believing yourself again.

So stop trying to regain confidence. 
That's not your job right now. 

Your job is simpler and way less glamorous, become someone you can trust again. 

Start stupid small. 
I mean, embarrassingly small. 
So small your brain can't argue with it. 

Don't promise you'll write a book. 
Promise you'll open the document. 

Don't promise you'll change your life. 
Promise you'll do one tiny thing and actually do it. 

It's boring. It's slow. 
But it's the only thing that actually works.

Let confidence show up on its own when you've earned it back.

It will. Faster than you think.
